techmeme.title: Filing: a Chinese court agrees to hear a Fortnite-like case against Apple by Bodyreader, a posture correcting app Apple removed in 2020; Bodyreader seeks ~$420K (Pei Li/Bloomberg)
Signal announces a suite of call features, including the ability to share a link to a call, emoji reactions, a "raise hand" button, and a dedicated calls tab (Jay Peters/The Verge)
A look at DeFlock, an open-source project that has crowdsourced the locations of 5,600+ automated license plate reader cameras globally from Flock and others (Jason Koebler/404 Media)
Bitcoin passes $89K for the first time, Tesla closes up 8.96%, Coinbase closes up 19.76%, and Robinhood closes up 7.4%, as investors pile into "Trump trades" (Financial Times)
Grab reports Q3 revenue up 17% YoY to $716M, vs $700.8M est., a $15M profit, and raises its forecast for fiscal 2024 revenue; GRAB jumps 10%+ after hours (Zaheer Kachwala/Reuters)
